result.execSummary:
The defendant Peter R. Stegner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th or 6th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
in Wisconsin State Prison System consecutive to any sentence previously imposed. Defendant is entitled to 4 days presentence credit.
Consecutive to: any sentence previously imposed

superMiscConds.notes: All Financial obligations shall be paid to the Clerk of Courts within 60 days unless a payment plan is established.
Shall submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety. Defendant shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock shall be installed on any motor vehicle owned and/or operated by defendant.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.

records.addlTxt:
10:02 AM Defendant Peter R. Stegner in court.  Attorney Karl A Green in court for Peter R. Stegner.  Attorney Margaret Anne Kunisch in court for State of Wisconsin. Court review rights, charges and penalties. Defendant enters guilty to Count 1. Court accepts waiver and plea; finds guilty of Count 1. ADA Kunisch heard. Attorney Green heard. Defendant waives statement. BAC was .288.  Court heard and imposes sentence: Atty Green heard as to the cash bail.  Court orders bond money to go to fine and costs. 

**18 mo IC, in the WI State Prison System to commence forthwith, not eligible for programs
**42 mo ES
conditions of ES:
**absolute sobriety, no bars, taverns, etc
**$3000 fine plus costs
**$26 blood draw
**36 mo rev
**36 mo ign int
**DNA sample/surcharge
**4 days of jail credit
